DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicate the number of target lesions at baseline imaging meeting the criteria defined by the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standard or basis upon which area of abnormal tissue is measured.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The goal intended to be attained.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Baseline; an imaginary standard by which things are measured or compared.

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/31/12 jc  Released as part of draft VD review with Tina Taylor.  1/4/08 jc created for ACRIN PET curation.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of lesions found in a positive finding.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:Involving advantage or good.:The result of an examination or inquiry.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The result of an examination or inquiry.
Determining the number or amount of something.
